Daniel has exactly $20$ pieces of candy.He has to divide them equally among his $3$ sisters.What is the least number of pieces he should take away so that he could distribute the candy equally?
To divide the $20$ candies equally among his $3$ sisters, we need to find a number that is a multiple of $3$ and also a factor of $20$. 
By examining the factors of $20$, we see that the only factor that meets this condition is $4$. 
So, Daniel can have $4$ sisters (including himself) to divide the $20$ candies equally among them.
solution: When you divide $20$ by $3$, you get $6$ with a remainder of $2$. Therefore, he should take away $\boxed{2 \text{ pieces}}$ so he could give each of his sisters $6$ pieces.
